column4: Afternoon, an upgrade from 8.04 to 8.10 has broken Audio playback.  Any pointers would be greatly appreciated! Thanks.
change audio settings  gstreamer-properties all to ALSA
hmm ok one moment
ok
snd go to "Preferences - Sound" and set everything to ALSA
ok I did that, then hit "test" and I don't hear anything :\
ok one sec plz
ok
ok done
!enter | hi_t_lerboyLOL
check also the volume in Volume control and in preferences to Alsa mixer
still nothing
have you installed the backports modules and the outstanding issues regarding intrepid in your soundcard?
nope, I'm a plug-and-play kinda guy, what should I install?
which sound card do you have?
00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801I (ICH9 Family) HD Audio Controller (rev 02)
newegg has it listed as Realtek ALC888
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/217789
I had the audio working a few days ago, nothing has changed since then :-\
i though you just installed intrepid?
yea few days ago, then i was gone for the weekend, started the machine back up and it's broken
it's probably the latest kernel? im sorry, i can't help more. there will probably a fix for this. you can check the bug reports or report a bug yourself if you don't see any. i have to go now
